title: On travel ban, activist judges are acting like dictators
text: Your editorial "Travel ban on standby" (March 19) is outrageous. You are blaming President Donald Trump instead of the liberal activist judges in Hawaii and Maryland who violated the law and the Constitution of the United States when giving their judgment on President Trump's temporary travel ban from six predominantly Muslim Middle Eastern countries. The law and the Constitution give the President of the United States the power to suspend immigration when he deems it to be in the national interest of the United States. The commander-in-chief has the fundamental right to determine who comes in our country as a matter of national security.
summary:
Your editorial "Travel ban on standby" (March 19) is outrageous.
You are blaming President Donald Trump instead of the liberal activist judges in Hawaii and Maryland who violated the law and the Constitution of the United States when giving their judgment on President Trump's temporary travel ban from six predominantly Muslim Middle Eastern countries.
The law and the Constitution give the President of the United States the power to suspend immigration when he deems it to be in the national interest of the United States.
The commander-in-chief has the fundamental right to determine who comes in our country as a matter of national security.
